sentence.Network_en: Actors learn how to enunciate clearly in the theatrical college.
sentence.Network_cn: 演员在戏剧学院学习怎样清晰地发音.

sentence.Network_en: He was ever ready to enunciate his views to all who would listen.
sentence.Network_cn: 他总是乐意向所有愿意倾听的人阐明他的观点。

sentence.Network_en: He is always willing to enunciate his opinions on the subject of politics.
sentence.Network_cn: 他总是愿意对政治问题发表意见.>enunciation/I9nQnsI5eIFn; I9nQnsI`eFEn/n[C,U].

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as enunciation): from Latin enuntiat- 'announced clearly', from the verb enuntiare, from e- (variant of ex-) 'out' + nuntiare 'announce' (from nuntius 'messenger')

entry.def: When you enunciate a word or part of a word, you pronounce it clearly.

example.ex: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully...
example.tran: 他一字一顿，听上去很生硬。

example.ex: She enunciates very slowly and carefully.
example.tran: 她缓慢、仔细而又清晰地读着。

entry.tran: 阐明；清楚而准确地阐释
entry.def: When you enunciate a thought, idea, or plan, you express it very clearly and precisely.

example.ex: He was ever ready to enunciate his views to all who would listen.
example.tran: 他总是乐意向所有愿意倾听的人阐明他的观点。

means.word_mean: 1. speak, pronounce, or utter in a certain way;

sentences.sentence: "She pronounces French words in a funny way"
"Can the child sound out this complicated word?"

auth_sentence.content: But if you say that, ya gotta be sure to enunciate.
auth_sentence.res_content: But if you say that, ya gotta be sure to enunciate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But if you say that, ya gotta be sure to enunciate.
